chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
Control Plane Dashboard Introduction

* To start sending control plane metrics, makes sure that your Kubernetes Collector and Proxy are on the latest version, and that the helm flag is set to true. * To learn more about the PPS impact of enabling Control Plane metrics, please see our sizing guidelines in documentation.

API Server SLI

The 99th percentile of request latency for the API Server over a 5 minute period.

charts.name: API Server SLI

sources.name: API Server SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.apiserver.apiserver.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

charts.description: The service level indicator (SLI) of the API server is measured as the 99th percentile of request latency

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
etcd SLI

The 99th percentile of request latency for etcd over a 5 minute period.

sources.name: etcd latency SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.apiserver.etcd.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
CoreDNS SLI

The 99th percentile of request latency of CoreDNS over a 5 minute period.

sources.name: CoreDNS SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.coredns.coredns.dns.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

sources.name: API Server SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.apiserver.apiserver.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

sources.name: etcd SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.apiserver.etcd.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

sources.name: CoreDNS SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.coredns.coredns.dns.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
API Server SLO

The 99th percentile of request latency on the API server for a 5 minute period should be < = 1 second , measured over a single day period.

sources.name: API Server SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.apiserver.apiserver.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

sources.name: API Server SLO
sources.query: 100 * (1 - mcount(30d, highpass(0, align(1m, max, default(0, ${API Server SLI})))) / (3600 * 24 * 30))

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
etcd SLO

The 99th percentile of request latency for etcd for a 5 minute period should be < = 1 second , measured over a single day period.

sources.name: etcd SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.apiserver.etcd.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

sources.name: etcd SLO
sources.query: 100 * (1 - mcount(30d, highpass(0, align(1m, max, default(0, ${etcd SLI})))) / (3600 * 24 * 30))

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
CoreDNS SLO

The 99th percentile of request latency for CoreDNS for a 5 minute period should be < = 1 second , measured over a single day period.

sources.name: CoreDNS SLI
sources.query: cumulativePercentile(99.0,rawsum(align(60s, mean, aliasMetric(mavg(5m, rate(ts(kube.coredns.coredns.dns.request.duration.seconds.bucket, cluster=${cluster_name}))), '')) by (le)), metrics, sources, pointTags)

sources.name: CoreDNS SLO
sources.query: 100 * (1 - mcount(30d, highpass(0, align(1m, max, default(0, ${CoreDNS SLI})))) / (3600 * 24 * 30))

sources.name: cpu_util
sources.query: limit(250, ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.node_utilization", cluster="${cluster_name}" and nodename="${node_name}" and node_role="control-plane") * 100)

sources.name: memory_util
sources.query: limit(250, ts("kubernetes.node.memory.working_set", cluster="${cluster_name}" and nodename="${node_name}" and node_role="control-plane") / ts("kubernetes.node.memory.node_allocatable", cluster="${cluster_name}" and nodename="${node_name}" and node_role="control-plane") * 100)

sources.name: storage
sources.query: ts("kubernetes.node.filesystem.usage", cluster="${cluster_name}" and nodename="${node_name}") / ts("kubernetes.node.filesystem.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}" and nodename="${node_name}")
